servinfo.title: Engine Vacuum Check
servinfo.ptxt: The engine vacuum that develops in the intake line is a good indicator of the condition of the engine. The vacuum checking procedure is as follows:

s1.ptxt: Warm up engine to normal operating temperature and make sure that engine idle speed is within specification.

attention3.ptxt: After warming up engine, place transmission gear shift lever in “Neutral” (shift selector lever to “P” range for A/T model), and set parking brake and block drive wheels.

s1.ptxt: Stop engine and remove engine cover.
Disconnect vacuum hose (1) from vacuum pipe.
Connect special tools (vacuum gauge and hose joint) to vacuum hose of intake manifold side.
Start engine and run engine at specified idle speed, and read vacuum gauge. Vacuum should be within specification.

spec.title: Vacuum specification
spec.ptxt: 52.6 – 65.8 kPa (40 – 50 cmHg, 15.7 – 19.7 in.Hg) at specified idle speed

s1.ptxt: Connect vacuum hose to vacuum pipe.
